intro: Elephantopus scaber var. scaber, commonly known as rough elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in stiff, rough hairs. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The species is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
